{{Refimprove|date=August 2007}} '''Anarchic Adjustment''' was a fashion clothing company originally founded in London in 1986 by [[Nick Philip]] and popularized internationally in San Francisco California by designer and entrepreneur Alan Brown, along with Charles Uzzell Edwards. London's post-punk Anarchic Adjustment moved to sunny California with the arrival of co-founder [[Nick Philip]] to the freestyle bicycle/skate scene of Southern California.<ref>{{cite book|title=Generation Ecstasy: Into the World of Techno and Rave Culture |author= Simon Reynolds|year=1999|publisher=Routledge|isbn=0-415-92373-5|url= http://books.google.com/books?id=tGaRJiXe74UC&pg=RA1-PA152&ots=NTY5n1rls5&dq=%22Anarchic+Adjustment%22&ei=t8m9RoyAPYXy6gKu1KjEBQ&ie=ISO-8859-1&output=html&sig=eN-9jlSV6bHcVr-HbbCRYfDSwog| page=152}}</ref>
Nick briefly worked at Freestylin' magazine where a 14-year-old [[Spike Jonze]] was an aspiring photographer under the stewardship of Windy Osborne, freestyle bicycle rider [[R. L. Osborn]]'s sister. Spike did some early photographic work for Ozone Freestyle and Anarchic during this time.
Nick Philip met Alan Brown, designer and owner of Ozone Freestyle Bicycle Company in 1988 at an AFA ([[American Freestyle Association]]) contest. Nick had tried unsuccessfully to interest various Freestyle and Skate related businesses in Anarchic and was ready to return to England as he was low on funds and visa extensions.
Alan understood the potential of Anarchic and was instrumental in bringing Anarchic from an idea consisting of three T-shirt designs to an internationally known fashion company.
[[Charles Uzzell Edwards]] joined Alan and Nick and together developed the "Anarchic" line which was noted for its beautifully bizarre graphics, textures, and outrageously profound designs.
Anarchic Adjustment opened two fashion shops in Japan, one opened in Tokyo in 1994, west of Ebisu station [http://www.connectedtokyo.com/index.php?main_page=page_3] and a second store in the American Village in Osaka inside the American Village Parco Store. Alan Brown, along with [[Joi Ito]] were responsible for founding the Anarchic stores in Japan.
[[Hiroshi Fujiwara]], DJ, [http://www.fragment.jp] (Tiny Panks) DJ, [[Mixmaster Morris]], [[Towa Tei]] of [[Deelite]], and [[Timothy Leary]] were early adopters of Anarchic Adjustment fashion. Hiroshi featured "Anarchic" in his Fujiwara Adjustment section of Cutie Magazine and [[Timothy Leary]] wore "Anarchic" whenever he could. <gallery> Image:Aa_tshirt_design_original.gif|Original Anarchic T-shirt art work Image:ozone_bike_ad.jpg|Ozone Freestyle Bike Ad from Freestylin' magazine, Designed by Alan Brown
</gallery>
